climbs.name: Morning Red
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe, Hannah North and Jeff Niwa  25 October 08

content.description:
Climb up the arete on the right side of the formation with the pointy tip, just right of Meadowlark.  Clip three bolts, then, take care with a large kind of secure block which dubiously accepts a couple of small to medium sized cams for protection.  Clip another bolt, ascend up to a low angle break at the shoulder of the formation, then traverse to the left and up to the fixed anchor.

Morning Red's gonna set me on fire...

New sun is coming gettin' higher and higher...

Mission Mountain Wood Band
content.protection: 4 lead bolts with a couple of supplemental cams in the small to medium range (#2 TCU to .5 Camalot or equivalent).
content.location:
Located on the right side of the south face of the North Tower formation with the spikey summit.  Start just left of the chimney and broken ground of the formation to the east.

Same rappel/belay anchor as for Meadowlark.

climbs.name: Meadowlark
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe, Hannah North, Jeff Niwa and Brad Shilling 25 October 08

content.description:
A nice, straight up line to a very thin, pointy summit spire.

Friction with some thin seams, a short, shallow roofy section, and a nice finish.

Take care tagging the spikey summit as the fixed anchor is below the very top, where the rock is more robust.
content.protection: Four lead bolts to be supplemented with small cams.  Suggest a selection of cams ranging from 00 to 2 TCU or equivalent.  A couple of small cams in the range of 00 and 0 might prove useful in between the first two bolts at a thin seam.
content.location:
Route is located directly up the middle of the south face of the North Tower formation with the very spikey summit.

Start on face to the right of a fourth class gully.

Rappel route from fixed anchor below the pointy summit spike.

climbs.name: In Without Knocking
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe, Hannah North and Jeff Niwa  26 October 08

content.description:
A pleasant, thin start up a smooth face leads to a couple short horizontal roofy breaks.  Up ya go.

In Without Knocking

was the lone album from the Mission Mountain Wood Band and the album art was the Charley Russel painting of the same name.
content.protection:
5 lead bolts to two bolt anchor.  A small cam or two takes the sting out of any potential runout.

Suggest a #1 TCU (or equivalent) past the third lead bolt.

Fixed anchor on top of route.
content.location:
Located on the left side of the eastern-most south facing formation in the North Towers.

To the right of the pointy formation containing the routes Meadowlark and Morning Red.  On the face just right of the deep chimney (climbed by Jeff and Hannah at ~ 5.7) and behind the tall pine tree.

Start just right of the large pine tree on the left-hand (west) side of the face.

Rappel route from fixed anchor.
